# acceptsFirstResponder

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the responder accepts first responder status.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var acceptsFirstResponder: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

As first responder, the receiver is the first object in the responder chain to be sent key events and action messages. By default, this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]. Subclasses set this property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the receiver accepts first responder status.

## Related Documentation

- **needsPanelToBecomeKey**: A Boolean value indicating whether the view needs its panel to become the key window before it can handle keyboard input and navigation.
- **Cocoa Event Handling Guide**

## Changing the First Responder

- **becomeFirstResponder()**: Notifies the receiver that it’s about to become first responder in its [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindow].
- **resignFirstResponder()**: Notifies the receiver that it’s been asked to relinquish its status as first responder in its window.
- **validateProposedFirstResponder(_:for:)**: Allows controls to determine when they should become first responder.
